definitions.definition: one of a pair of long narrow pieces of wood, metal or plastic that you attach to boots so that you can move smoothly over snow

examples.text: All skis should be waxed on a frequent basis.
The children go to school on skis.

definitions.definition: either of the pair of long flat boards on which a person stands in order to waterski

wordOrigin: mid 18th cent.: from Norwegian, from Old Norse skíth ‘billet, snowshoe’.
